did.unittitle: Social Science Research Council records, Soviet Studies, Record Group 3, Series 6

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Social Science Research Council archives are arranged into three record groups distinguished by the date of their donation to the Archive Center. Accession 1 (Record Group 1) consists of the documents received by the Archive Center in 1990; Accession 2 (Record Group 2) was transferred to the Archive Center in 1994; Record Group 3 was transferred to the Archive Center in 2017-2018.

SSRC, RG 3, Series 6, Soviet Studies, is divided into four subseries: 1. Programs and Development; 2. Fellowship Records and Institutional Support; 3. Fellowship Records - Declinations (Graduate Training, Dissertation, and Postdoctoral); and 4. JCSSS and Eurasian Program.
These subseries divisions were created in the course of processing in order to facilitate access to the materials. There is overlap between subseries, however, and the divisions are not always exact.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Social Science Research Council donated its records to the Rockefeller Archive Center as an unrestricted gift by Certificate of Gift dated December 17-21, 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Soviet Studies series of SSRC, RG 3, Series 6, documents the activities of the Joint Committee on Soviet Studies (JCSS), later known as the Joint Committee on the Soviet Union and its Successor States (JCSSS), and its associated subcommittees. The records consist of meeting materials, minutes, and correspondence; funding inquiries and applications; subcommittee records relating to meetings, membership, and workshops and conferences (presentations and planning); and especially materials stemming from and concerning the administration of fellowships and other awards programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Programs and Development subseries documents the establishment and operation of the Joint Committee on Soviet Studies from the early 1980s to around 1994. It contains records of its meetings from 1983-1991 and chronological files from 1987-1993. The subseries includes correspondence and requests for funding from foundations, the National Endowment for the Humanities, and especially for program funding from the U.S. Department of State, through the Soviet-Eastern European Research and Training Act of 1983 (Title VIII).

The JCSS established several subcommittees to advance field development in Soviet Studies. This subseries includes the records of these committees and, in particular, of their meetings, conferences, workshops, and other activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: General file concerning applications for funding under Title VIII; contains drafts of proposal sections. In addition to the JCSS, the Title VIII Consortium included the Joint Committee on Eastern Europe, the International Research and Exchanges Board (IREX), the Kennan Institute of Advanced Russian Studies, and the National Council for Soviet and East European Research (NCSEER).

did.unittitle: USA - USSR Youth Summit, Teleconference Series, Old Dominion University, Programs 1-3 (2017:022:02 - 2017:022:03)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three-part Youth Summit program organized by Old Dominion University and the Soviet State Radio and Television. The first two programs focused on life and culture in the Soviet Union. The third program, on March 11, was a live, two-way video exchange between students in the U.S. and the Soviet Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Fellowships and Institutional Support subseries contains the fellowship files of individuals awarded Title VIII fellowships (Graduate Training, Dissertation, and Postdoctoral) from 1985-1995. In addition to this major fellowship program, it also includes records of the Rockefeller Foundation-sponsored International Fellowship Program and its individual fellows from 1985-1991.
Title VIII-supported Summer Language Institutes for training in Russian and other slavic languages are also an important component of this subseries.

Finally, the subseries documents awards to institutions and individuals for various training and field development programs: the creation of new teaching positions, faculty retraining, support for "underrepresented fields" in Soviet Studies (anthropology and sociology), individual participation in JCSS-sponsored workshops, research and development projects, and projects to expand access to research materials. The files frequently document both the successful applicants as well as those who were declined.

There are no Title VIII fellowship declination files for 1992; the subseries is also missing dissertation fellowship declinations for 1991 and 1995.

did.unittitle: JCSSS (Joint Committee on the Soviet Union and Its Successor States) and Eurasian Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The JCSSS and Eurasian Program subseries reflects various ways the SSRC reoriented its Soviet Studies program following the collapse of the Soviet Union in the early 1990s. Materials concern fellowships, workshops, and conferences addressing social, political, and economic changes in the post-Soviet world and in its academic study. The subseries includes early conferences on Soviet Studies and a series of workshops, 1991-1994, reconsidering the History of Imperial Russia. Other materials relate to the SSRC's review of its international programs and area committee structures, particularly in relation to Soviet Studies and the former Soviet Union. Several files pertaining to Title VIII funding and support for Soviet Studies, 1982-1995, are also found in this subseries. Other materials concern programs and fellowships designed to strengthen social sciences in former Soviet states and conferences focusing on Central Asia.

While most of the materials in this subseries date from 1991-1995 and view Soviet Studies as encompassing the Soviet Successor States and sometimes Central Asia, the subseries also includes some files from the mid-1980s - early 1990s that would more properly be filed in other subseries in the collection and that may relate directly to other materials in these subseries. There are also a few miscellaneous files arranged at the end of the subseries.

did.unittitle: Fertility Decline and Recent Changes in Russia (Paper)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fertility Decline and Recent Changes in Russia: On the Threshold of the Second Demographic Transition, by Elena I. Ivanova and Sergei V. Zakharov. The paper was presented at a conference sponsored by RAND's Center for Russian and Eurasian Studies and the Center of Demography and Human Ecology, Institute for Economic Forecasting, of the Russian Academy of Sciences, June 5-6, 1995. It is not known if or how this paper relates to JCSSS programs.
